item.title: Open-source: If You Build it Right, They'll Come
item.description: I find open-source to be a rather loaded term; it means different things to different people. For this blog post, I’ll imagine there are two kinds of open-source products: Company-owned open-source Crowd-owned open-source I’m writing this blog post specifically about company-owned open-source products. In a typical company-owned open-source product, the company pays us to develop and maintain the product. I’ve been working on the Azure Communication Services UI Library that falls into this category.
